description: Transitioned Full Time to Kansas Fiber Network, in effort to move closer to home and take part in an exciting new opportunity to design, operate, and grow a state-wide Distribution and Aggregation Transport network from greenfield state to production. • Responsible for building and updating Initial Contacts Repository, Circuit Inventory and Component Inventory Databases and Tools. • Responsible for researching, grading, and purchasing all tools for traffic management, SNMP/Syslog collection. • Primary in-house trainer on completing Circuit Orders in Internal and Industry Standard Circuit Inventory and Order Systems. • Primary Engineer on KFN Voice Services (Tandem Switching Platform). • Key Liaison between KFN Network Operations and Control Center. • Procured parts and electronics for installation and implementation as Central Office Engineer. Included Rack and Cabling Layouts, and Scope of Work Summaries. • Conducted migration of additional 19 Central Offices to the KFN Tandem. Included ordering and turn-up of all signaling circuits. SS7 Validation, Cross-Connect Ordering with multiple IXC's. • Continued overall design of Translations Schema for MetaSwitch Class-4 Platform. Integration of all devices and peripherals. • Transitioned all CABS Billing from MACC Billing System to Innovative Systems. • Key participant in study and design of Office LAN and Back Office IT Systems. • Network Planning and Coordination for a 37 Router, MPLS-IP network using Alcatel-Lucent 7x50 devices. • Additional support for cut-over and integration of additional DWDM Nodes to complete Phase I Network Design. • Primary Design Architect for Wireless Backhaul and Carrier Ethernet Solutions deployed by Kansas Fiber Network. • Technical Design Architect for Kansas Fiber Network Long Distance Product. • Dedicated support and mentoring to new and existing KFN personnel, educating them on the unique dynamics of this network.

title: Network Engineer (Voice Switching, SS7 Services, and Central Office Eng)
description: Missouri Network Alliance (now a part of Bluebird Network) was a Network founded in 1999 by 15 Independent Rural Telephone Companies that brought Broadband Services and Connectivity to many communities and businesses in the State of Missouri. My contributions: • Assistance in Network Design and Implementation of the Missouri Network Alliance Tandem. Creating for a high-speed, low latency, fault tolerant Platform for Class-4 Voice Switching Platform for 15 ILEC's and 23 End Offices. • Provisioned Circuits in Sonet Network (DS-0, DS-1, DS-3 OC-3, OSC-3c, OC-12 facilitating the transmission of Voice and Circuit Switched Data to the Missouri Network Alliance Tandem. • Facilitated in Circuit Design, Circuit Orders, Firm Order Commitments, and Supplementation for Inter Exchange Carriers Inter-connectivity to the Missouri Network Alliance Tandem. • Created Test and Validation Procedures for all Trunk Testing, Call Termination, Call Testing, and Translation Verification for all End Offices re-homing Feature Group D Services to the Missouri Network Alliance Tandem. • Provisioned and helped maintain the DS-0 Circuits for MNA's SS7 Aggregate STP Platform, including Route Costing, Implementation of A-Links, and Route Sets. Included Testing and Verification. • Responsible for detailing procedures in SS7 Protocol Analyzer for Queries as well as Signaling. Mentored other technical employees in SS7 Troubleshooting Methods and how to isolate anomalies and Least Cost Routing instances. • Developed Formal Troubleshooting Procedures for engagement of Technical Resources and distributed to End Offices, greatly assisting, explaining and resolving Call Completion, CABS Billing, and Call Quality Issues. • Performed Collocation and Collocation Augment Applications with RBOC's/ILEC's in the State of Missouri. • Procured parts and electronics for installation and implementation as Central Office Engineer. Included Rack and Cabling Layouts, Scope of Work Summaries, and Job Start Agreements.

title: Network Engineer II. (Network Quality Engineering/Tools & Service Availability)
description: Focused on a new objective with a new direction within Sprint-Nextel. Network Quality Assurance/Engineering was a task force of Subject Matter Experts focused on improving the Sprint-Nextel Network Reliability and Availability. As a team member of NQA/NQE my responsibilities were: • Dedicated work as a liaison between Field Operations, Switch Operations, and Centralized Network Operations (which included NOC's and NTAC) • Responsible for Project Coordination of Alarm Library Library Testing of all existing and new Vendor Platforms into Sprint-Nextel's Production Network. • Responsible for writing command syntax and rules for Automated Processing for Testing and Certification of circuits as well as full Cell Site/Card/Sector resets. • Created training curriculum for Nortel Cellular Network in partnership with Sprint University of Excellence. • Created troubleshooting Job Aides for every Actionable Alarm in the Nortel MTX/iDEN Switch/P-MSC (Packet Mobile Switching Center) with Summary, Definition, Root Cause, and Resolution Action for Field Operations/Network Operations Center in IBM Netcool System. • Responsible for working with multiple work groups (Network Operations Centers and Field Operations) which supported IBM-Netcool/HP-Openview/TTI-Netrac II/Kiwi/Homegrown Trap Collectors. • Lead Project team to standardize Trap Collection format from all Vendors, including detailed instructions on how to host an Alarm Library Review, How to break down the Alarm Messaging/Code, and how to Specify/Request Enhancements through Change Control Processes for different Device API's. • Mentored Several Engineers in Sprint Technical Triage (Developmental TAC). Assisted in Troubleshooting calls with Market/NTAC/Vendors. • Discovered multiple missing traps and alarms that were Critical in Nature on P-MSC Platform. Worked with Sprint STIC (Sprint Testing and Integration Center) Lab to validate Code and Performance of latest Software Revisions on this platform.

As well as support for first P-MSC Inter Operability deployment with Motrola eBSC and RAN. • Provided Trouleshooting and Maintenance Support for Sprint CDMA MTX (Mobile Telephone Exchange) and BSC (Base Station Controller Complex) as well as CSDM (Cabinetized SuperNode Data Module) used for AMA Billing.

description: Resumed Telecommunications career full time while taking courses through Ottawa University in evenings. In this position I worked as a Technician in the Sprint-Nextel Wireless (PCS) Network Operations Center: • Monitored circuits and components in Sprint-Nextel’s CDMA Network (1xRTT and 1xEvDO). • Performed System Recovery and First Level Technical Assistance for Sprint-Nextel Field Operations. • Testing and Troubleshooting of Alcatel Lucent 1631X DACS, Tellabs 5500 Titan. Tested rates from DS-0 to OC-48 using REACT Software for Digital Carrier. • Extremely high performer, was asked to develop training of all new NOC personnel on Nortel and Lucent CDMA Network (1xRTT and 1xEvDO) networks. • Developed procedures that assisted NOC in Non-technical matters. • Obtained a 74% Skills Placement in 90 Days allowing me to work Nortel, Nortel IOS (Motorola/Samsung BSC – Nortel DMS MTX), and Lucent CDMA Network Markets. 97% Skills Assessment Placement in 6 months allowing me to work Sprint Nextel Voicemail, Fixed Wireless and other solutions. • Primary Support Engineer for all Sprint CDMA Markets following Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita in 2005. First Level Triage, Project Coordination, Generator Dispatch, NOC Team Lead for Storm Markets. • Assisted Engineering in developing Scripts and Filtering following the aforementioned Hurricanes to focus efforts to the continued support and rebuilding efforts of those markets and communities. • Consistent Top Performer in Operations Center Statistics. Served as a mentor for many Network Operations Technicians that came after.

Along with the wireless DWBS and Spectralink systems for Lucent Avaya. Became a Tier 3 Field Engineer in Portland OR.and then decided to retire and went to work for SPS in '07 to present.
